review: Fridays suckered us in with a coupon for a free appetizer.  We will know better next time! First off, no complaints with service or front of the house folks.  They were all very pleasant and nice. But the food...oh, the food.  Appetizers we ordered potato skins and mozz sticks.  The mozz sticks were nice, but the potato skins had the smallest, measliest amount of cheese on them.  But, no biggie...if the main course was good, that could have been ignored. The main course...was NOT good. Hubby had the Bruschetta Chicken Pasta.  Chicken was dry, it wasn't seasoned or flavored very well.  I had the Grilled Shrimp Scampi and Salmon with a side of broccoli.  The shrimp was decent, but the kitchen KILLED the salmon, completely overcooked, and the broccoli was yellow and sad and incredibly salty.  I also had sweet potato fries...unremarkable, but at least not bad like the rest of the dish. To top it off, the bill was like $42.  I would expect MUCH better for $42.  Will never return!

First time sitting in the dining room at this location. I didn't like it. The set up was nice and it all looked like a Fridays, but the wait staff threw me off. Back home, Fridays is known for their drinks but the prices in NJ are higher then they are in Columbus. I wasn't expecting them to have the same prices. Expect your drinks to cost $10 each. A cheap drink here is around $8 or $9.  The food at this location isn't what I remember. The chicken wings, something I used to get all the time in college, were dry and bland; only thing I tasted was "hot". The potstickers were pretty bad too. It's such a shame, like I said, I used to love Fridays but this location has me wishing I was back home. Seems this place just cant cook. I got the fried shrimp which gives you a lot of food for the money. The shrimp had this weird off flavor to it, similar to when the shrimp aren't cleaned first which was surprising since I thought these were frozen and just baked. I don't have a lot fo expectations for Fridays so I tend to judge them higher automatically since this was my hang out in College. But this location just isn't worth going to, esp since the prices are so much higher then what I'm used to seeing out here.  Past experiences here would leave me never ordering anything aside from app's, cocktails, and burgers. With prices high on drinks and the apps being bland, and a recent change in only serving well done burgers I cant see myself coming back here.  I think the only reason I gave them such a high review last time was I came with a buzz already. I don't tend to see price signs when Ive been drinking lol. they do have a really cool bar though

I took a friend of mine to dinner this afternoon and he got to choose where we were going to go.  He really liked his sirloin but my ribs were seriously devoid of meat.  The service was good though but I'm never going back.

Meagan was a great waitress, my group ate here twice, after having a wonderful dining experience we went back and requested her a second time!  I have never been the biggest fan of Friday's but they have good food and an easy atmosphere... The first time was the day I flew in I was tired and my coworkers were in a rush and knew exactly what they wanted, so I opened the menu saw the long platter of Jack Daniel's sliders and went for it...  These were the thickest sliders I have ever had, i did not need to eat all 4 but I did...LOL I can be a pig...  The flavor was on point and I can't imagine many people finding disappointment in these beefy treats... The second time I did a Jack Daniel's combo with sirloin and chicken, the meat was all flavorful and the veggies were perfect, the only thing I would change for next time is the mash potatoes the consistency was questionable, next time I will substitute in sweet potato fries or onion rings for sure! Meagan was great she kept the drinks full and was ready for any request and some of my coworkers can be high maintenance to say the least! Friday's you are better then I remember!

This is a classic TGIF store.  We get lots of offers via email and FB, so we rarely go in a pay full price.  With this advantage, TGIF is actually a great value, often about the same as a fast food burger place.  There's definitely a formula to this place and little originality, but the basics are there and well done.  Go, but take a coupon.
There is only 5 cars in the parking lot yet I still had to wait 12 minutes for my server to bring a side of ranch dressing. Not impressed.

Been quite a spell since I've been to this place and I was happy to return. We sat in the bar area and were served early and often. I had the parmesan chicken and my wife had the captain Morgan chicken sandwich . Both were excellent choices the flavors and textures were spot on. They lost a little when they took our refill order then forgot about it. But it only resulted in a delay of about 10 minutes. Overall it was decent food decent service and decent prices.
My GF loves this place, I do not know why!!!! The food is very generic and overpriced! This is a dying business indeed!

The only reason for me to give a 2 star instead of 1 is because of their service. The Waitress who served us was nice, call me babe a lot but it's fine with me.  Okay, their food. Are terrible. We ordered two burgers. All came out BURNT like on fire burnt. The buns are dry. Ribs we ordered was crispy, I've never got crispy ribs before I don't know about anybody else.  We returned the burger, the manager came out and apologized, that was nice, but make it better. seriously.

We frequent this place every once and a while and tonight it seriously was fantastic. Usually I'd say a 3-4 stars, but Tonight topped this! My Boyfriend and I sat at the bar and had an amazing bartender (William) and two other ladies, I am not aware of their names though, but they were fantastic! The food was wonderful and the drinks were perfect! $3.00 Long Islands on Thursdays as well! I can say that these drinks were made correctly and not over powered with pop or the lemonade mix.  Fantastic trip!!!! Next time, we will definitely be sitting at the bar with William!

I stop by TGIF Friday's yesterday, to use the free appetizer I received from filling out a quick survey online that was attached to my recipt from the Reynoldsburge location. I order the flatbread which was pretty dang good for a late evening snack and order two long islands that where on special for $4 loved it. Everything was good, it was pretty late on Wednesday so no annoying crowd just a few people enjoying the game and muching down on there apptizers. It was a good night#

Sat by the bar to eat; the staff were very attentive. The food took a bit long to receive but I later learned they were short staffed in the kitchen. They had great sports & news channels on so I wasn't bored. The drink & food specials are plentiful & great. I like this Friday's.

It is what it is...a Fridays!  The food can be a crap shoot sometimes, meaning sometimes it is sooooo good and then other times it can be a greasy mess.  But if you like their offerings then you won't go too wrong here.  Service has always been good and sometimes interesting like when I got into a sci-fi movie discussion with the server. I really liked that they had $4 glasses of certain wines the day I went and I'm a sucker for their fried green beans.  Fried green beans? Rather defeats the purpose of a healthy low calorie veggie, huh? It happens!  If Friday's food is your thing then go forth and enjoy.

Nice location. The wait was a little crazy when we went but I suppose it could've been worse. Several tables opened up and searing had not begun, so that was a little weird. It was dinner time so I'm sure they didn't have staff go home. In fact, when we asked, they said they would accommodate and seated us within minutes of one of those empty tables. Rather weird. Food was great though. Service was good too. Though there was a server working the bar that was...very odd. He was attentive, bust just strange. Not to be mean about it, but if we knew we were getting his table again, we would wait. The guy was THAT weird.

Waiter was very friendly, however he brought B&B plates with ketchup all over them for us to eat our appetizer platter off of. Salads arrived before he returned with clean B&B's and entrees were brought before we were halfway done with salads. They kept asking to clear plates that we were still obviously working off of. It just seemed like we were being rushed. Both steaks came out well done; my wife ordered medium and I ordered mid rare.. the waiter dropped the check off before our re-fire even made it back to the table without offering desert. My first visit to this location was great which is why I'm granting 3 stars.. but this visit has lost my business completely. Never going back.

My experience here last night was good! Bartender was friendly and food was satisfying. Some things I wish were different though was the bartender took a while to check back in with us after ordering drinks to order food. there were a lot of menus and it wasn't super clear what their specials were. I ordered the chicken and shrimp which is super delicious but I probably wouldn't get it again because the tails were still attached to the shrimp and the chicken and shrimp was served with an abundance of mashed potatoes and cheese with just a little bit of vegetables. I still like this place though and would go back

Came in for some beer and an appetizer. The bartender immediately greeted us, however we told him we wanted bud light drafts and he continued to ramble off drinks to us. Then he gets us beers and orders our app, then we don't see him. Another person brought us our app, no big deal, however we never received any napkins or silverware.  The whole time we were there, two other bartenders or servers came to the computer directly in front of us, and they never asked if we needed anything. Our bartender finally comes up to us when we are completely out of beer and our food is done, after about 10 minutes being done. At this point we just want to leave and he says "I'd hate to see you go". If that was the case then maybe he should have gave us better service...

I'm sure this is a fine restaurant for a lot of people but we are retired and prefer sit down and be served meals when we go out.  This was available but the food was mediocre at best.  We chose not to have a drink and ordered our meals.  That was nearly the last we saw of our server.  Younger people who like bars and bar food will love it here but for us old fogies there is no great draw.

The service was great but our order got messed up.  Nothing to write home about, just ended up here because I had a gift card and this was the closest one.  They lure you in with unending appetizers but what they don't tell you until you get there is that you can't share the appetizers.  Lame.

This used to be one of my favorite places to go but now whenever I go in and order a burger I always end up sending it back because they don't know how to cook anything well-done. I always emphasize well done absolutely no pink and it always comes back pink. Jack Daniel's chicken is really good but dammit sometimes you just want a burger
Food came out fast and hot but also delicious!! Great environment! All the staff we encountered were great! Better background music than other restaurants.

As has been the case recently, I had to succumb myself to the glutenous Polaris shopping area north of Columbus to take advantage of it's close proximity to Costco, World Market, Target, etc. Providing my family with some basic, affordable essentials due to a recent relocation has been a must. Speaking of basic essentials, our afternoon culinary pursuits have included eating at some of America's most generic "not quite fast food" chain restaurants. Why did we choose TGIFridays? Basically, the decision boiled down to realizing that my wife had a $25 gift card in her purse and it had to be used. We were also curious to see if we could get her, my 2 year old daughter, and I fed at or below the $25 mark.  The last time I ate at a TGIFridays was around 1999. The memorabilia and flare that famously hangs from every wall and ceiling in establishment evokes me to feel like I just ate there last week. Not much has changed over the years, except for the loud music selection which was all about Avril Lavigne. My wife ordered some sort of endless portion soup and salad lunch deal. The Caesar salad that she ripped through was highly concentrated in a dressing that appeared to be pure mayo. I took a bite... it really may have been pure mayo. I also could have drank her broccoli and cheese soup like a glass of milk. Talk about a combo that could be dangerous... mayo and cheesy soup. Luckily, she fared just fine. My daughter got a hamburger (or as she likes say, a "Hanga-burger") with some fruit on the side, and a special scoop of vanilla ice cream to help celebrate her second Memorial Day on this Earth. As was the case in my review of O'Charleys, which is across the street from TGIFridays, she seemed to enjoy the food. This is really the only reason why I rated my experience 2 stars instead of 1... she was entertained and actually wasn't picky throughout the meal. It must be a butter/sugar/salt thing that inundates the menu. It's probably a way to get the customer hooked at a young age. I recall from over a decade ago that TGIFridays actually has decent French Onion Soup, so I ordered a bowl and half of a club sandwich. The soup really is decent, but it made me extremely thirsty. I think I had 3 refills of iced tea. In the end, our bill came to tally just over $23, so we achieved our goal not to spend a single cent of our own money (unless you're counting tip). The next time I go to a TGIFridays, I may find myself in a spot like Polaris again shopping at Costco, World Market, and Target for the basic essentials that my daughter will need as she goes off to college.
Went there last night, I was pretty decent, went there on a night where it was 3.00 Martinis, that was a good deal. Waitress was great. There was no wait there either ( Wednesday night around 7)

Kind of disappointed with this place. I've always loved their food, but.... In order to get the happy hour specials you have to be seated at the bar? Why? We had out 16 month old son with us, & they don't make booster seats high enough to accommodate the pub height tables that are in the bar. - 1 star. Then service was just blah. Could've been better. The server made sure to tell us non of our drinks came with free refills, even my sons' apple juice. Really? We're paying close to $100 when this is all said & done & we can't get a refill on an infants apple juice? That's just irritating. Also the place was empty, but they sat us at some funky round table. People with kids prefer booths. We are like pack mules & need a place to set all of the babies stuff so we can eat. Just sayin. Food was OK. But just OK. Nothing spectacular.

The bartender girls working weekday evenings here (middle aged blonde & an older blonde) always seem to have an attitude and treat you as if you are an inconvenience!   It takes forever for them to even recognize you exist and take an order.  I have been at restaurant\bars that are just as busy with only one bartender that move faster then these two do.  They need to learn if you are going to be slow, a smile and great personality towards your customers will take you a long way!!!  Then it took them just as long to get their attention to cash out despite having my card out on the counter for ten minutes!!!'  Not a recommended place to enjoy a drink and appetizer!!!
I was disgusted to find a bug in my drink!!! One of those grey bugs you poke and it rolls up into a ball to protect itself.

extremely disappointed in bad quality and service of $12 endless appetizers..Fridays needs to drop this concept as the kitchen can't keep up, puts the waiters in a bad spot with patrons..takes forever between servings..spinach dip is horrible

Somebody else said it best "It is what it is...a Fridays!  The food can be a crap shoot sometimes, meaning sometimes it is sooooo good and then other times it can be a greasy mess" Very hit or miss. This is to include staff very hit or miss.

My husband and I went here yesterday as we were traveling back from our Labor Day weekend trip. We stopped in for lunch around noon and were greeted by the most monotonous hostess. (Seriously, the least enthusiastic person I've ever seen at a restaurant.) We were greeted quickly by our waiter and were able to have our order taken within 5 minutes. Our waiter was a little socially awkward, but I appreciated that he was very attentive to us. I got the Truffle burger, after figuring they didn't have a lunch menu since it was a holiday, and it was just all right. The burger was a little burnt and wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be.  As I decided not to ask about the lunch menu since it was a holiday and I figured they would have given one to us if they were actually serving lunch portions, I was frustrated to see a patron ordering something off of a lunch menu when we were leaving. (Entrees for $6-7 rather than the $12-15 menu we ordered from.) My husband and I paid nearly $35, including tip, for the two of us just for lunch. It seemed a little steep considering we only ordered 2 burgers/fries (my fries were substituted for side salad for no charge.) We don't plan to go back.

Most of my experience with TGI Friday's at this location have been at lunch time - I think I've only been here for dinner once or twice. So -- when it comes to rating the service, my comments are based on my lunch time experiences.  This is actually one of our favorite lunch time haunts.  My wife and I come here at least once or twice a month for lunch and the service has always been exceptional.  With the exception of one over-zealous (translate that as "over-bearing / over- attentive"), the lunchtime staff have all been exceptionally good - prompt, courteous and professional.  And -- after asking the over-zealous waiter to "back-off" a little, he complied. For some reason, I had never associated TGIF's with burgers but but what brings us in and keeps bringing us back for lunch are their burgers.  I'm sure there's other stuff on the menu but my wife and I are both hooked on the burgers.  Between us, we've tried most of the varieties on the menu and all have been very good.   This is a good place to get "in and out" during your lunch hour and the burgers certainly won't disappoint you.

Wow. I totally forgot that I came here in the past.. smdh. So, I ordered sizzling chicken and shrimp. Shrimp was good. Chicken wasnt all that. I didnt finish my meal. My husband got the jack daniels chicken and shrimp. My husband did not even finish his meal. He instantly started to feel sick. We took everything to go and left. I will be sure to check my yelp before i eat out again! Geez.

I stopped by today and has some ribs and chicken. The sauce was a bit sweet, but tasty. The sweet potato fries were great.  The service was a bit slow, but today is a holiday and the place was getting full Over all, we had a good time, the food had flavor. Will definitely come back

I was in the area for a couple of other errands, and I've been seeing that rib trio ad for weeks.  You know, the one with bacon on the ribs.  How could I resist? I got the ribs, plus a Caesar salad to try to at least look healthy.  The salad was good- they pointed out that the dressing was more a vinaigrette than the typical creamy one, and it was fine.  The veggies were fresh. The ribs came, and had good fries and excellent slaw on the side.  So, more health food!  I tried the bacon-topped ribs, the chipotle, and the Memphis dry rub.  I was prepared to be disappointed- but they weren't bad.  Oh, not great, but there was some flavor in the meat itself, and the texture was about what I like- tender with a little pull.  The sauced ribs were oversauced, but in the case of the bacon ones I guess they need something to hold the pieces on.  And though I figured bacon on top of ribs would be overwhelmingly fatty, it worked fine.  Sort of the ultimate dry rub, savory and salty (okay, it wasn't dry with that sauce, but maybe you can see what I mean.) Service was very good.  The decor is fine, if forgettable.  Pricing was fair- $10 for about half a rack.  They're baby backs, though, so it's a small rack.  I won't be running back here, but if I'm with a group that just has to go, I'll be able to get something decent.
Very helpful nice waiters and great prices on drinks. Love the alcohol drink with the balls lol. Only been twice but great experience both times.

My first time eating at this location, food was pretty good, we both had the endless apps. Walked in at like 4pm on a Thursday and was told there would be a 15 minute wait when there was literally 40 tables open in the restaurant. Still not sure why. But we waited because we wanted the endless apps. Finally got seated at a table that had been open the whole time we waited. Server was pretty good and food was too.

I'm only giving this a one star because I can't give it a zero. My wife, father in law and I went to lunch and we were extremely dissatisfied with the food & service.  It took a long time to get service. When we did get our food it was Luke warm. My wife had bourbon mahi mahi and the serving was small but the price wasn't. Her broccoli and mine were cold. My father in laws shrimp and fries were Luke warm.  Lunch took 90 minutes because of the slow service. Nobody bothered to ask how our meals were. We tried something different than our normal dining choices and this was a bad one.

Very very slow service and the food takes forever. Servers are clueless and have no idea of their surroundings. I am a server myself and watched TWO TABLES sit on a Friday night for over 25 minutes before we finally stopped the host and told them not a single person had stopped by their table to do a GREET let alone get them something to drink! We were just standing there waiting to get sat and multiple servers, as well as managers, walked past the table without noticing the guests looking around for service or someone to even notice them! Lol WHAT!!? When we got sat, we were in the bar and the bartenders service was pretty good. We had to wait about 20-25 minutes between round of endless apps and sometimes they were cold when they finally came out.  Overall, awful place to have lunch or dinner. There are multiple places to choose from at Polaris and Friday's should not be one!  (Unless you have 3 hours for dinner and want cold food)

Love the bar staff here. So friendly and personable! They have great bar drink specials every day. Had the Jack Daniels ribeye and Jack Daniels chicken. Both were excellent!  The spinach side was perfectly seasoned.

Currently at this location and as a Gm of my own restaurant, I'm appalled. First I ordered 2 drinks, one of which was to be a double shot, I couldn't taste any liquor in either...then my food arrives, and it is the wrong salad. The waitress, maybe assuming I'm blind or possibly deaf, inappropriately complains to her coworker about her mistake, which was passed off on me...apparently adding goat cheese to a side salad is too complex for the staff here. Needless to say we won't be returning. I guess the 2.5 star rating should have been warning enough not to waste time and stick to my regular spot, BJs!

Came in 6:30 on a Thursday, pretty slow. We were immediately seated and ordered our food. Salads came out after 15 minutes, definitely a rip off for $3.50, very little salad, wilted lettuce,and they were out of half there salad dressings. Food took about 30 minutes total with a 1/4 of the restaurant full. All of this with the server not checking in or even asking how the salads were. The food wasn't great either. Definite waste of money and will not be coming back. No manager in site.
I have been here a few times and it has been lousy each time. Tonight however was great! William was my bartender and was excellent! Recommended the bourbon chicken which was Amazing! Will be back:)

This place is wonderful! We both got ribeye steaks and mashed potatoes. Hubby got the cheddar Mac and cheese, I got broccoli. Big portions and a huge, perfectly cooked steak! Waiter (Dan) was amazing as was the manager.

I like Fridays in general but there is a bad smell in the bar, sorry to say, but like vomit or mold.   I have been there with my family 3 times to make sure it was not by accident and if it was just a bad day.  All 3 times it smelled.   We cant go there anymore.  Food is good, but smell is bad.  If management is listening please fix the smell so I can come back

Yup, this place sucks now. I havent been in for about 3 months, so I came in for the endless apps, which I looked up online to make sure it was going on before I made the trip here. Of course when I get ready to order, I'm notified they don't have it even though it's on their website. They got rid of my next selection, which was the reuben. I ended up ordering the full rack of ribs, which was more like a half rack if you were to order it anywhere else. The ribs came out semi warm. I had enough points for a free dessert, so I ordered the brownie obsession, which is now half the size it used to be. I should have gone to Makenzie River across the street instead.

So if you've been to a Friday's, then you pretty much know what to expect here. It's standard American casual fare. We were there in the evening, and it wasn't especially crowded, so we got seated quite quickly. Overall, I'd say that there wasn't anything that especially stood out here. The food was ok, and the service was decent. That's about the gist of it.

We stopped here for lunch on Monday and we both ordered burgers. They were delicious and cooked perfectly to order. I substituted grilled asparagus for the endless fries but my meal came with fries. The waiter apologized and quickly brought out my freshly grilled asparagus which was really tasty. I was worried that they would be overcooked, but they still had a nice bite to them and were seasoned well. My husband ordered the Caesar  salad with his meal while I had the tortilla soup. Both were good. Meals also came with choice of chocolate chip or macadamia nut cookie. One really nice aspect was that they brought out a sampler of a beer that my husband wasn't sure if he would like. So he got to taste it before ordering!

Dear Lord, never again. Yuck yuck yucky yuck.  Boyfriend has the mixed grill with sirloin and chicken, Chicken was so dry It was stiff, stiff enough that it could have been used as a hockey puck. The medium rare sirloin was burnt.  I ordered the prime rib and lobster. No! Bad lobster, you should not look like a dry white turd shriveled up from the exoskeleton of a poor tortured creature named Mr. MyBodyWasWastedOnThis? The prime rib was dry as heck as well.  Sides? Sweet potatoe fries, meh. Mac and cheese? Meh. Potatoes, decent. Cole Slaw, dry. Lemonade? Cool.  Public Service Announcement: honestly save your wallet for something better it WILL be worse then the frozen diner you forgot about from two years ago. But hey the service was good.

Wait staff was clueless. Husband's food was cold & had to be sent back. Management didn't care at all. Won't be back.  Also, waitstaff continued to call me Babe & Honey. Unprofessional, irritating, and unacceptable.
